meanings.definition: Yauped (verb): past tense of yaup, to utter a loud, raucous cry
meanings.sent1: The coyote yauped in the distance, startling the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The crowd yauped with excitement as the band took the stage.
meanings.sent3: The toddler yauped happily when she saw her favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm yauped angrily, shaking the windows with its power.
meanings.sent5: The warrior yauped a battle cry before charging into the fight.

meanings.definition: Yauped (adjective): characterized by loud, raucous cries
meanings.sent1: The yauped parrot could be heard throughout the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The forest was filled with the sounds of yauped monkeys swinging through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The yauped laughter of the children echoed through the playground.
meanings.sent4: The yauped howls of the wolves pierced the silent night.
meanings.sent5: The yauped protest could be heard from blocks away.
